snippet: States have spent less on tobacco prevention over the past two years than in any period since a settlement in 1998, despite high revenues from the settlement and taxes, according to a new report.
abstract: Report by Campaign for Tobacco-Free Kids finds that states, faced with tight budgets, have spent less on tobacco prevention over past two years than in any period since national tobacco settlement in 1998, despite record high revenues from settlement and tobacco taxes.
lead_paragraph: States have spent less on tobacco prevention over the past two years than in any period since a settlement in 1998, despite high revenues from the settlement and taxes, according to a new report.

headline.seo: Antismoking Outlays Drop Despite Tobacco Revenue
headline.main: States Cut Antismoking Outlays Despite Record Tobacco Revenue
headline.print_headline: States Cut Antismoking Outlays Despite Record Tobacco Revenue

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
